message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a solution based on Fully Convolutional Neural Networks (FCNN) for accurate segmentation of the right ventricular (RV) blood pool from cine MRI sequences. This involves the optimal combination of three concepts (the convolution Gated Recurrent Units (GRU), the Generative Adversarial Networks (GAN), and the L1 loss function) and the use of ROI-GAN to better guide the FCNN learning by combining global and local Region Of Interest (ROI) features. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV), Machine Learning (cs.LG), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), Multimedia (cs.MM), and Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-categories.
